Text: Behold, how good and pleasant it is when brothers dwell together in unity!
Context: This opening verse sets the theme of harmony and the delight found in unity among God’s people.

Text: It is like fine oil on the head, running down on the beard, running down on Aaron‘s beard, over the collar of his robes.
Context: The imagery of anointing with oil, a sign of consecration, depicts the blessing of God upon unity, compared here to the sacred anointing of Aaron, the high priest.

Text: It is like the dew of Hermon, descending on the mountains of Zion; for there the LORD has bestowed the blessing—life forevermore.
Context: The refreshing and life-giving dew of Mount Hermon symbolizes the divine life and blessings that come with living in unity; the mention of Zion highlights the spiritual significance of the place where God’s presence dwells.
